title: Algorithm Problem-Solving Learning Process Utilizing Visual Cues

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary computational thinking and simple logic structure comprehension
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices via BYOD and acquire intermediate-level algorithmic approaches to solve social issues.

learning_goals: Learners can identify core elements of algorithmic problems with 80% accuracy using color-coded visual cues.
Learners achieve a 70% or higher solution rate for algorithmic problems of up to three steps in mobile environments through color differentiation.
Learners can explain at least three ways color-coding affects problem-solving focus through formative assessments.

resources: Mobile Learning Module with Color Coding

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
